publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.article-title: Marine Corps Logistics Command Warehouse Optimization Model

bio.p: Major Amber Coleman is currently the executive officer at Combat Logistics Battalion 6 in Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, and recently transitioned from her position as an operations research analyst at Marine Corps Logistics Command (MARCORLOGCOM) in Albany, Georgia. She graduated from the United States Naval Academy in 2004 with a BS in quantitative economics. She received an MS in supply chain management from Syracuse University in 2012 and an MS in operations research from the Naval Postgraduate School in 2016. Major Coleman’s military experience includes two Operation IRAQI FREEDOM deployments, command at the platoon and company level, and multiple staff-level positions.

CWO3 Amanda Aultman is currently stationed aboard Marine Corps Logistics Base, Marine Force Storage Center, Albany, Georgia. She assists the command with planning strategic operations by transporting high-priority military equipment to Marines abroad. Her duties include load planning and loading military aircraft, vessels, rail cars, and tractor trailers. In addition to her primary duties, she supports the command’s storage initiatives by designing optimal storage solutions to maximize storage space and reduce maintenance costs.
